metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0737 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Object Storage (Swift) before 2.4.0 does not properly closeclient connections, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (proxy-server resource consumption) via a series of interruptedrequests to a Large Object URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-swift - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-account - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-container - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-object - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-object-expirer - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-proxy - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: swift package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5').
